page.title: 18Village Life, Shelton
page.content: Shelton has 21 houses with 43 adults and 9 children living in them. There are 2 houses owned by the North Bedfordshire Borough Council, 2 rented houses, 2 tied cottages and the rest are privately owned. 3 households have no car. All the others have more than 1 car. Medical attention can be sought from Kimbolton which is in Cambridgeshire and patients are referred to either Bedford, Huntingdon or Cambridge if they need hospital treatment. There are no shops in the village but there are mobile shops and delivery services which provide; bread, groceries, meat, fish milk and dairy produce. Newspapers can be ordered from the shop in Upper Dean. The closest Post Office is also at Upper Dean.The nearest towns for shopping are Kimbolton and Raunds.
